channel.title: powershell on Ryan Jan
channel.description: Recent content in powershell on Ryan Jan

item.title: Managing vSphere Global Permissions with PowerShell
item.description: It appears that working with vSphere global permissions in PowerCLI is not yet possible. The VIPerms PowerShell module combines the add/remove examples from William’s post with a new function to list all global permissions. In this post I will demonstrate how to install and use this module.

item.title: Get ESXi Host CDP Info With PowerCLI
item.description: Introduction I recently had to provide our networking team with a list of ESXi hosts and which switchports each of their physical NICs were connected to. Like many other environments, we are primarily a Cisco house and therefore I was able to get this data by querying the Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP) information via PowerCLI. Here is how I went about it. The Process I will initially show you how to pull this information for a specific host.

item.title: PowerShell Tips: Script Optimization
item.description: Introduction A colleague of mine recently asked for some help with a script he was writing. We use vSphere tags in order to determine which backup schedule a given VM is in and he wanted to find all VMs which were not assigned a tag in the category backup-service-level, and therefore were not being backed up. His actual query was regarding filtering out certain VMs which will never be given a backup tag.
